question: Most common organ involved in retroperitoneal fibrosis is?
exp: Ans. (b) Ureter. Ref.: Campbell 10th ed./ 1108-1112* Ureters are involved most commonly.* MC site is lower third.* Obstructive uropathy is the earliest and most common specific symptom.* 70% cases are primary or idiopathic (Ormond's disease)* Investigation of choice is CT scan.* In patients with renal compromise, MRI is the investigation of choice.
